basic.floral_language:
Calendula officinalis
Floriography: perseverant, sunny, positive
Calendula officinalis is a herb in the family of chrysanthemum,. Has obovate leaves of single layer or multiple layers petals, like small sun flowers in orange or yellow color, clustered flowers especially dazzling beautiful in a sunny day. Suitable for indoor or flower beds.
Calendula officinalis likes plenty of sunlight, but in summer need to be placed under bright scattered light. Flowering from April to September, available for 3-4 weeks.
basic.blooming: Flowering period April-September, viewing period 3-4 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, dilute fertilizers following instructions,  in early summer, spring and autumn apply fertilizers once monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, old, diseased, and dead leaves timely
